title: The Common Fisheries Policy. Origin, Evaluation and Future
abstract: How the community operates the policies for structures, markets and external fisheries the building of a conservation policy the house of cards - adopting total allowable catches 1983-91 technical conservation measures and control and enforcement - modifying the regulations political expediency versus scientific advice evaluating the conservation policy the scientific basis of the conservation policy searching for effective solutions the future development of the Common Fisheries Policy changing the decision making process managing the fisheries of the community. Appendices: definitions of technical terms and explanations of Eurojargon list of stocks for which the Community fixes TACs acronyms.
